(4) Execution Matters

Amateurs talk about strategy and tactics. Professionals talk about logistics and sustainability […]. (Robert H. Barrow [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Robert_H._Barrow])


The Execution Gap Erik Wilde (@dret): Team Structure for API Programs: Missions and Organization

(5) Leadership 1-2-3

  • Set a vision as the goal to improve the organization
    • Digital Transformation will help us to thrive in the increasingly digitalized world
  • Define a strategy how to turn the vision into reality
    • APIs are a necessary component of digital transformation
  • Have a program to turn the defined strategy into reality
    • Designing and building good APIs has business, organizational, and technical aspects

Beyond API Technology Erik Wilde (@dret): Team Structure for API Programs: Missions and Organization

(7) API Journey: Assessment/Enablement/Coaching

  • Assessment uses analysis and observations
    • Figuring out the status quo
    • Monitoring the landscape for directing investments
  • Enablement addresses identified gaps
    • Creating and maintaining API strategy/program/guidelines
    • Trainings and workshops for enabling all teams
  • Coaching for continuous architecting
    • Monitoring the API landscape and identifying changing practices
    • Monitoring technologies and tools for improving the practice


Beyond API Technology Erik Wilde (@dret): Team Structure for API Programs: Missions and Organization

Teams Matter

Teams Matter Erik Wilde (@dret): Team Structure for API Programs: Missions and Organization

(10) Conway's Law

Any organization that designs a system (defined broadly) will produce a design whose structure is a copy of the organization's communication structure. [http://www.melconway.com/Home/Conways_Law.html] (Mel Conway [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Melvin_Conway])
  • Learn from all of Conway's laws
    1. Focus on communications (Communication dictates design)
    2. Support continuous process (Be able to do it over)
    3. Improve team independence (Interdependent teams create interdependent systems)
    4. Keep project scope small (Big problems/systems tend to shape-shift)


Teams Matter Erik Wilde (@dret): Team Structure for API Programs: Missions and Organization

(11) Consequences of Conway's Law

  • Technical leaders must have a say about organization design
  • Not all collaboration/communication is good
  • Four types of teams:
    • Stream-aligned: Deliver value with minimal hands-offs
    • Enabling: Grow capabilities of stream-aligned teams
    • Complicated-subsystem: Reduce cognitive load of stream-aligned teams
    • Platform: Make stream-aligned teams autonomous
